intro: Hippeastrum microcarpum, commonly known as the dwarf hurricane lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact size and vibrant orange-red flowers. The plant produces narrow, strap-like leaves and has a bulbous underground stem that stores nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Hippeastrum microcarpum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
